item.title: PM Modi Commissions INS Kolkata, India's Biggest Naval Destroyer
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today dedicated INS Kolkata, the biggest indigenously-built naval destroyer, to the nation.

item.title: PM Modi Speaks At the Commissioning of INS Kolkata: Highlights
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today addressed sailors at the commissioning ceremony of the country's largest indigenously-built warship INS Kolkata in Mumbai. The stealth destroyer is a part of the Kol...

item.title: India Have Learnt Nothing From Defeats: Sunil Gavaskar Tells NDTV
item.description: Sunil Gavaskar slammed India's batsmen for failing to show any patience and falling to deliveries that did not deserve wickets after the tourists were bundled out for 148 on the opening day of the fin...

item.title: I Would Have Picked Rohit Instead of Binny: Laxman
item.description: The Indian think-tank had tested Stuart Binny in the first couple of games but the all-rounder was hardly utilised as a medium-pacer before being replaced in the next two Tests.

item.title: PM Modi Will Commission This Warship Today
item.description: Exactly two months after he embarked on India's biggest warship, aircraft carrier INS Vikramaditya, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will once again visit a naval establishment today to commission an indi...

item.title: Mid-Day Meal Scare in Madhya Pradesh: 8 Children Hospitalised in Serious Condition Now Out of Danger
item.description: Eight children who were admitted to the Sehore district hospital in a serious condition after consuming a mid-day meal at their local school are now out of danger, hospital authorities said.

item.title: Imran Khan Vows to Lead Protests Until Pakistan PM Quits
item.description: Pakistan's cricketer-turned-politician Imran Khan said Saturday he would continue to lead protests in Islamabad along with thousands of his supporters until Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif steps down.

item.title: Heavy Rain Claims 19 Lives in Uttarakhand
item.description: Nineteen people have been killed in the last 24 hours in landslides and incidents of house collapse as heavy rain continued in the hill state of Uttarakhand on Saturday.

item.title: Modi Promises Bank Accounts for All Families in India
item.description: In a speech meant to set a national agenda for his new government, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday announced plans to make bank accounts available to every Indian family, a complex goal that, i...

item.title: England vs India, 5th Test: Live Blog
item.description: India have some mixed memories of the Kennington Oval in London. It was here that India beat England for the first and only time in 1971. In their last meeting in 2011, England thrashed India by an in...

item.title: England Dominate Opening Day Despite MS Dhoni's Gutsy Innings
item.description: At Friday's close, England were 62 without loss in reply to India's meagre 148 all out, a deficit of 86 runs.

item.title: PM's Choice of Turban: The Jodhpuri Safa
item.description: As Prime Minister Narendra Modi delivered his maiden Independence Day speech today, his bright red-and-green turban wasn't just a sartorial statement, but it seemed to showcase his journey to the coun...

item.title: EPL: Van Gaal Confident of Rooney
item.description: Louis van Gaal handed the armband to Rooney and he will skipper the Red Devils for the first time in a competitive match in their Premier League opener against Swansea City.

item.title: At Rashtrapati Bhavan, PM Modi Signs Autographs for Public
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi radiated warmth and effusiveness of President Pranab Mukherjee's "At Home" party. He broke cordons and met people, chatted, greeted and gave autographs

item.title: One Daughter Can Serve Parents Better Than Five Sons: PM Modi's Top 10 Quotes
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today addressed the nation from the Red Fort in his first Independence Day speech. He spoke extempore, without a bullet-proof glass giving him cover.

item.title: Come, Make In India: PM Modi's Invite To the world
item.description: From Delhi's imposing Red Fort early on Friday morning, Prime Minister Narendra Modi made an extempore first Independence Day speech, telling the world, "Come, make in India. Sell anywhere, but manufa...

item.title: Discrimination Fears Rife in Telangana as State Prepares for Survey
item.description: A state government survey to be held on August 19 has struck fear into the residents of Telangana. While the government insists it is meant to stop leakages, residents fear it is a precursor to denyin...

item.title: Jet Airways, Etihad Partner to Offer Fliers Discounted Fares
item.description: Jet Airways and its strategic investment partner Etihad have offered discounts ranging from 20 per cent to 68 per cent to fliers on regular fares over the combined network of the two airlines.

item.title: Imran Khan Travelling in Bullet-Proof Car After Vehicle Shot At
item.description: Cricketer-turned-politician Imran Khan, leading protesters to the Pakistani capital of Islamabad for a sit-in demanding the ouster of Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, today boarded a bullet-proof car afte...

item.title: 53 Children Hospitalised in Madhya Pradesh After Eating Mid-Day Meal at School
item.description: 53 children were admitted to hospital today after consuming mid-day meals served at their school in Icchawar in Madhya Pradesh's Sehore district.

item.title: Zest, Bolt Success Holds Key to Tata Motors Car Business Profits: Moody's
item.description: The profitability of the struggling domestic unit of Tata Motors, especially that of its passenger car division, depends on the success of the newly-launched sedan Zest and the forthcoming Bolt, Moody...

item.title: Delhi School Students 'Discover' Two Asteroids
item.description: Two new asteroids have been discovered by a team of students from two schools in Delhi as part of a nationwide campaign.

item.title: China Inaugurates New Tibet Rail Link Close to Sikkim
item.description: China today inaugurated its second railway line in Tibet, built at a cost of USD 2.16 billion, close to Indian border in Sikkim, enhancing mobility of its military in the remote and strategic Himalaya...

item.title: Narendra Modi's Slogan Spree in Maiden Independence Day Speech
item.description: "Zero defect, zero effect" was one of the many slogans Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave today in his 65-minute long maiden speech from the ramparts of Red Fort to drive home his point.
